message: I don't see any as "must buys." I have never purchased a slipcase. I have a backpack with a laptop compartment that I use.
Laptops don't need cases. Get a laptop bag they are awesome.
and a mini displayport to HDMI / DVI adapter will certainly come into handy at some point

I hate the alluminum / plastic feel of macbooks, so i wouldn't own another without a rubberized / grippy shell like the http://www.speckproducts.com/macbook-cases/macbook-pro-cases-13/seethru-satin-macbook-pro-case-13-black.html

Here are some boring must-haves that will likely last you through a few upgrades:
* bluetooth mouse; I *gasp* like the mighty mouse it can run off of 1 OR 2 AA's.  2 lithiums last me about a year
* extra power adapter (1 at home on the desk, 1 in the bag - or at least the trunk of your car)
* Apple Care, on my last MacBook Pro I got: 3 batteries, a hard drive and 1 logic board all for free with Apple Care (well worth it).

I know these accessories are not very sexy, but they are must have in my book in addition to the bags mentioned here.
I usually go with the STM glove / incase slip case & AppleCare, but I have to agree having extra power adapters comes in handy.
@jacksontomlinson you must be a boy scout growing up?!
except for the external mouse, I don't think anything else is a must buy. love the trackpad, but you can't play portal with it
Griffen mini USB cables are great if you're on the go with multiple devices. https://store.griffintechnology.com/desktop/usb-mini-cable-kit
solid gold kama sutra coffee pot
If you don't have a cleaning cloth, then get one of those.
MacBook pro comes with one, but yeah I love microfiber on all apple stuff with glass.
It was eluded to by @unwrangle, but sign up to steam & get portal & portal 2 ;p
@markbate I mean "alluded", not "eluded". Drunken me is fighting grammar nazi self.
So I just bought a MacBook and despite saying 'slipcase' earlier, I got an incase backpack instead. Mostly because I needed a backpack that wasn't for hiking anyway.
